message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about chemical reactions and the properties of substances. When a chemical process occurs, it can result in the formation of new substances with different chemical properties. Option (C), adding lemon juice to milk, is an example of a chemical reaction. When lemon juice (which is acidic) is added to milk (which is basic), it causes the milk to curdle and form a new substance with different properties. Option (A), adding cats to a home, does not involve a chemical reaction. Option (B), adding cream to tile, does not result in the formation of new substances with different properties. Option (D), adding salt to sand, is a physical mixture and does not involve a chemical reaction.

This question requires knowledge about chemical reactions and how they can result in different chemical properties. When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs that causes the milk proteins to curdle. This changes the chemical properties of the milk, turning it into a substance with a different texture and taste. Adding cats to a home (option A) and adding cream to tile (option B) have nothing to do with chemical reactions or resulting chemical properties. Adding salt to sand (option D) may cause a physical change in the mixture, but it does not result in new chemical properties.

This question requires knowledge of chemical reactions and how they can change the properties of a substance. When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction called curdling occurs. This changes the chemical properties of the milk and results in the formation of curds. Option (A) is unrelated to chemical reactions. Option (B) is incorrect because adding cream to tile does not result in a chemical reaction but rather a physical change. Option (D) is also incorrect because adding salt to sand does not cause a chemical reaction but rather a mixture of the two substances.

This question requires knowledge about chemical reactions and how they can change the properties of substances involved. When lemon juice is added to milk, it causes a chemical reaction that results in the curdling of the milk. This changes the chemical properties of the milk, making it different and new. Option (A) is unrelated to chemical properties and involves a different type of addition. Option (B) is unrelated to chemical reactions and involves a different type of addition. Option (D) is unrelated to chemical properties and involves a mixture, not a chemical reaction.

Option (B) is a mixture of substances and not a chemical reaction. Option (D) is also a mixture of substances and does not involve a chemical reaction.

Option (D) is also incorrect because adding salt to sand would not result in a chemical change, just a physical mixture.

This question tests your knowledge of chemical reactions and their effects on different substances. When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs. The citric acid in the lemon juice reacts with the protein in the milk, causing it to curdle and form a new substance. This change in chemical composition results in the milk developing new chemical properties. Option (A) is incorrect because adding cats to a home does not involve a chemical reaction. Option (B) is incorrect because adding cream to tile does not involve a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because adding salt to sand does not result in a chemical reaction.

Option (A) is unrelated to chemical reactions. Option (B) does not involve a chemical reaction, but rather a physical change in the appearance of the tile. Option (D) does not involve a chemical reaction either, but rather a mixture of two substances.

This is due to the acid in the lemon juice reacting with the proteins in the milk. The curdled milk will have different and new chemical properties compared to the original milk. Option (A) is unrelated and not a chemical process. Option (B) is also unrelated and does not involve a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because adding salt to sand does not result in a chemical reaction or new chemical properties.

This process changes the chemical properties of the milk, resulting in the formation of curds and whey. Options (A), (B), and (D) do not involve chemical reactions and do not result in the formation of new chemical properties.

When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs that causes the proteins in the milk to denature. This changes the chemical properties of the milk, causing it to curdle and form a new substance. Option (A) is incorrect because adding cats to a home is not a chemical process. Option (B) is incorrect because adding cream to tile is not a chemical process either. Option (D) is incorrect because adding salt to sand does not result in a chemical reaction, but rather a mixture of salt and sand.

This question requires knowledge about chemical reactions and the resulting changes in chemical properties. When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs where the lemon juice acids cause the milk proteins to coagulate and form curds. This changes the chemical properties of the milk, turning it into a new substance called curdled milk. Options (A), (B), and (D) are not related to chemical reactions and do not involve the formation of new chemical substances.

This question tests basic knowledge about chemical reactions and their effects on substances. When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs and the milk curdles. This change in the chemical composition of the milk gives it new properties, such as a thicker texture and sour taste. Option (A) is unrelated to chemical properties. Option (B) describes a physical change, but not a chemical change. Option (D) also involves a physical change, as the salt and sand can be easily separated. Only option (C) describes a chemical reaction that results in new chemical properties.

This question tests understanding of how chemical changes result in new chemical properties. When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs. The citric acid in the lemon juice reacts with the proteins in the milk, causing the milk to curdle and form a new substance, which is buttermilk. This change in chemical composition and physical properties demonstrates the concept of a chemical change. 

Option (A) is incorrect because adding cats to a home does not involve a chemical reaction or result in new chemical properties. 
Option (B) is also incorrect because adding cream to tile does not result in a chemical reaction or new chemical properties.

When lemon juice is added to milk, a chemical reaction occurs that causes the milk proteins to break down and coagulate, resulting in a new substance with different chemical properties than the original milk.
